snippet: In November, the European Space Agency landed a probe on a speeding comet, but it lost battery power after 60 hours. The spacecraft began transmitting data packets to earth on Saturday.
abstract: Solar-powered European spacecraft Philae awakens from hibernation on the surface of Comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko; begins sending data back to the European Space Agency, with which it had lost contact following battery failure in November.
lead_paragraph: In November, the European Space Agency landed a probe on a speeding comet, but it lost battery power after 60 hours. The spacecraft began transmitting data packets to earth on Saturday.

headline.main: Philae Spacecraft Reawakens on a Speeding Comet With Data for Scientists
headline.print_headline: Probe Awakens on Speeding Comet and Sends Back Data
